  • Example one

Expansion panels

Use expansion panels to contain content and save space on a page.

  1. Read more expansion
  2. Heading expansion

1. Read more expansion

Use the read more expansion when you want to hide a large chunk of text when space is at a premium.

Heading 1

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed pharetra est id elit auctor tristique..

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed pharetra est id elit auctor tristique. Aliquam vestibulum gravida mi eu ornare. Aenean tristique ac leo at eleifend. Class aptent taciti sociosqu ad litora torquent per conubia nostra, per inceptos himenaeos. In hac habitasse platea dictumst.

HTML goes here.
Angular example usage:
<app-readmore heading="Heading 1" initialExpanded="false"><div>Intro text></div><div>Read more text></div></app-readmore>

Angular component:
                    
import {Component, Input } from '@angular/core';
import { generateUID } from '../utils.js'

@Component({
                        selector: 'app-readmore',
                        templateUrl: './readmore.component.html',
                        styleUrls: ['./readmore.component.scss']
})
export class ReadMoreComponent {

                        constructor() { }

  @Input() initialExpanded: boolean = false;
  @Input() heading: string;

  uid: string = generateUID();

}


Angular template:
                    
<section class="readmore">
    <h3>{{ heading }}</h3>
    <input id="{{ uid }}" type="checkbox" [attr.checked]="initialExpanded">
    <div>
        <ng-content select=".readmore-intro"></ng-content>
    </div>
    <div>
        <ng-content></ng-content>
    </div>
    <label for="{{ uid }}"></label>
</section>

1. Heading expansion

Use the heading expansion when you want to hide a large chunk of text when space is at a premium.

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed pharetra est id elit auctor tristique. Aliquam vestibulum gravida mi eu ornare. Aenean tristique ac leo at eleifend. Class aptent taciti sociosqu ad litora torquent per conubia nostra, per inceptos himenaeos. In hac habitasse platea dictumst.

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed pharetra est id elit auctor tristique. Aliquam vestibulum gravida mi eu ornare. Aenean tristique ac leo at eleifend. Class aptent taciti sociosqu ad litora torquent per conubia nostra, per inceptos himenaeos. In hac habitasse platea dictumst.

HTML goes here.
Angular example usage:
<app-expansion heading="Heading 1" initialExpanded="false">Main text</app-expansion> <app-expansion heading="Heading 2" initialExpanded="false">Main text</app-expansion>

Angular component:
                    
import {Component, Input, OnInit} from '@angular/core';
import { generateUID } from '../utils.js'

@Component({
                        selector: 'app-expansion',
                        templateUrl: './expansion.component.html',
                        styleUrls: ['./expansion.component.scss']
})
export class ExpansionComponent {

                        constructor() { }

  @Input() initialExpanded: boolean = false;
  @Input() heading: string;

  uid: string = generateUID();

}


Angular template:
                    
<section class="expansion">
    <input id="{{ uid }}" type="checkbox" [attr.checked]="initialExpanded">
    <label for="{{ uid }}">{{ heading }}</label>
    <div>
        <ng-content></ng-content>
    </div>
</section>
